objects.title: Settings
objects.text: Select options that affect the CYOA itself.

objects.title: Drop-In
objects.text: It looks like you are keeping your own body and will brave the tower as you are. Be careful who you share your secret with.

objects.title: Reincarnation
objects.text: You will be leaving your old body behind to take one specially provided for your new adventure.

objects.title: Towerborn
objects.text: You originate from inside the Tower on one of its many floors. Even if you are born in the tower, Headon may overlook you if you lack the potential to climb the tower or play into one of his many schemes.

objects.title: Irregular
objects.text: You originate from outside the Tower. It is uncertain how you managed to get inside the Tower, but you will find yourself before Headon on the First Floor where he will determine your potential to climb the tower. This option places you in the same category as Rachel to Baam, or the Family Heads to Zahard.

objects.title: Chosen Irregular
objects.text: There is no doubt about it; you entered the Tower under your own power. Fate will conspire to see your success as you climb the Tower. It is no longer required for you to enter the Tower on the First Floor, though you will have to begin your climb on the Second if you choose to accept Headon's offer. One day you will join the other monsters that have graced the Tower such as Urek, Zahard, and Enryu. Until then, Baam may become a healthy rival or dangerous adversary.

rows.title: Apparent Age
rows.titleText: Your real age isn't as important as how you're perceived based on your apparent age. Young or old, you can still climb the Tower. Your apparent age is linked to your personality/mental age.

rows.title: Races
rows.titleText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
defaultAddonText: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.
